title: Inpex sells November Australian Van Gogh crude at higher premium-sources
text:
Inpex sells November Australian Van Gogh crude at higher premium-sources

Commodities 19 minutes ago (Oct 18, 2019 19:35)

© Reuters. Inpex sells November Australian Van Gogh crude at higher premium-sources SINGAPORE, Oct 18 (Reuters) - Japan's Inpex Corp has sold a cargo of Australian Van Gogh crude at a premium of more than $13 a barrel to dated via a spot tender, two trade sources said on Friday. The 300,000-barrel cargo was offered to load Nov. 19-23. The buyer was not immediately known. Earlier this month a November-loading Van Gogh crude cargo traded at the same premium. Gogh and other Australian heavy sweet crudes have been selling at strong premiums over the past several months, supported by strong demand from traders who are buying for blending into marine fuels to meet new shipping rules on lower sulphur content set to take effect in January 2020.

Inpex sells November Australian Van Gogh crude at higher premium-sources
